issue.description: Maintenance misspelled. Corrected by reviewer.
DIS copyright notice is missing from cover

comment.description: Updated the cover page to conform to DIS as per Supplementary directives.

issue.description: Abstract is missing

comment.description: Fixed the XSL so that if no abstract is provided, the scope statement is used.

issue.description: If document is DIS, then there should be a supersedes number, and that is missing.

comment.description: A modular AP can go straight to DIS stage which is the case her therefore no Supersedes document.

issue.description:
In the foreword "Subsequent annexes are for information only."
should say :
"Annexes F and G are for information only."

comment.description: Added informative annex references.

issue.description: The boilerplate is for a TS, not sure if this applies for a DIS document.

comment.description: Updated the foreword to conform to DIS as per Supplementary directives.

issue.description: Is shading allowed in tables? The SD's use shading to distinguish examples from the text, but since shading is not allowed in figures, I suspect it is not allowed in tables.

comment.description: Assuming the issue is against "Figure 2 Market segmentation", the figure is a figure, not a table. Furthermore, how are you supposed to convey the information without shading?

issue.description: the words "for example" is in one of the scope statements, which means it should be tagged as an example.

comment.description: The scope is pulled from the AP module. The scope has been fixed in the AP module.

issue.description: Introduction In the caption of Figure 1, the word "Vision" should not be capitalized.
Only two modules are referenced in the ARM and MIM short form, yet there are many modules listed in the normative references. Please explain why all these references are needed.

comment.description: There was an agreement at Poitiers that the higher level modules in an AP should be described in clause 4, so they are needed as they are normatively described in clause 4.

issue.description: ISO CS has been questioning the use of dated references. Is it necessary to refer only to the versions listed? Or could undated references be used?

comment.description: this will be a biggish change to the XSL - also, it will affect the modules, a number of which are on their way to ISO.

description.p: SC4 Response: In view of the need to maintain configuration control across a modular structure, SC4 will need to refer to specific dated issues of modules. This requirement will be reviewed as modules become increasingly stable.
ISO response: Thank you for the explanation. No action required.

issue.description:
Use boilerplate specified in ISO Directives, Part 2:
"The following referenced documents are indispensable for the application of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies."

comment.description: RBN - I presume you mean replace: " The following normative documents contain provisions which, through reference in this text, constitute provisions of this International Standard. For dated references, subsequent amendments to, or revisions of, any of these publications do not apply. However, parties to agreements based on this International Standard are encouraged to investigate the possibility of applying the most recent editions of the normative documents indicated below. For undated references, the latest edition of the normative document referred to applies. Members of ISO and IEC maintain registers of currently valid International Standards." I have replaced it.

issue.description:
3.18 Abbreviations
ASPI: Why are all words except "set" capitalized?
The acronym FAA stands for "Federal Aviation Administration".

comment.description: RBN - because the acronym is: APSI - Assured set of Product and Support Information "set" is not part of the acronym.

issue.description:
4 Information Requirements
NOTE 1 The information requirements correspond to those of the activities identified as being within the scope of this application protocol in Annex E.
The reference should be to Annex F, not Annex E. (The hyperlink actually goes to Annex F.)
Since there is only one note in the section, this note should not be numbered.

comment.description: Fixed in the XSL

issue.description: The references to modules that are followed by a punctuation have an unnecessary space between the module number and the punctuation.

The figure 1 is confusing. Are the 8 boxes on the left (labelled Product Structure - Support Performance) held in the Disc/Database labelled Life Cycle Shared Data? If so, the diagram is confusing: if not, where are they stored?

comment.description: Redraw the diagram showing arrows from the boxes on the left to the lifecycle database.

issue.description: The images used for the diagrams in the activity are from a previous revision. The content is the same, but the revision numbers have been updated. The latest images should be used.

comment.description: Corrected. The script for converting the AAM HTML to XML was/does not copying the images.

issue.description: For icom F1.252 product needing support, definition reads *These elements The include*.

comment.description: Corrected by deleting *The* from *The include*.

issue.description: html errors reported by homesite, in clause TOCs and in contents.xml. These are caused by hrefs to non-existent contents.xml#copyright. Should these , as in the modules, point instead to cover.xml#copyright (also non-existent, at the moment)?

comment.description: Changed to link to copyright notice on cover page as per modules

description.p: (3) Paragraph: Figure 5
Relationships between ARM concepts represented into the graphical view shall be oriented in order to facilitate the understanding of the data planning model
(2) Clause: 10303-239 Annex C
Third sentence: The words "may" and "either" are not acceptable here. Normative definitions are needed on how to implement this part of ISO 10303.

Change the sentence to: "The file format shall be encoded according to either the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and in the MIM referenced in A.2 of this part of ISO 10303.
How does this apply to part 28?
The wording should be: "The file format shall be encoded according to the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and in the MIM referenced in A.2 of this part of ISO 10303."
Change made and issues copied to stepmod/doc/issues/apdoc_issues.xml
(2) Clause: WG3N1451
(3) Paragraph: -
The AP239 DIS Validation report does not contain any concrete example of an AP239 data set. It only refers to documents not accessible for the national bodies of TC184/SC4
Either add detailed examples to the validation report or make those examples available as regular TC184/SC4 documents.

comment.description: We regret that the information was not available. However, since the ballot further significant validation work has been done in the form of documenting the model as OASIS Data Exchange Sets. (http://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=plcs) This work can be accessed at http://sourceforge.net/projects/dexlib. This work is ongoing. In addition there are several pilot deployments of PLCS, such as the use of PLCS by Norwegian Defence to acquire though life information for Frigates. This is contributing t the development of the DEXs.

description.p: (3) Paragraph: 6
AP239 will not only be used for data exchange but also for data integration. Therefore it is needed to add SDAI as a valid implementation method.
Add 10303-22 and its language bindings as valid implementation method

comment.description: For discussion, see similar comment UK-LSC-TT-12.

description.p: (2) Clause: 1

The scope of the standard is not clear. It is not clear were the distinction to e.g. AP 233 is. Something like a competition with other APs is wasting resources and should be avoided, e.g. System Product Structure & Functional Product Structure [ISO 10303-1216 ] should be domiciled in AP233.
Please improve the scope and describe a clear separation to other emerging standards.

comment.description: The sharing of module between APs is deliberate to foster harmonization and common implementation. As a result of this comment we will change the introduction to improve the description with AP233. (The penultimate paragraph in the Introduction)

description.p: (2) SC4 part number: 10303-239
(3) Clause: 1. Scope
(4) Paragraph: Overall

In SC4 Standing Document (N1686), "Guidelines for the content of application protocols that use application modules", 4.4 describes as follows for the content of Scope of Modular AP document.
"Clause 1 of an AP shall define the domain of the AP and summarize the fundamental concepts and assumptions of the scope, the functionality of the AP, and the types of information that are accommodated by the AP. A description of the functionality and information that are specifically outside the scope of the application shall be defined to clarify the domain of the AP."
N1686 also describes as follows by NOTE 2 in 4.4.
"The required text of the scope clause is generated by the SC4 Module Repository. The scope bullets are derived from the AP Module. Paragraphs describing the domain of application are added by the AP editor."
The current Scope clause of AP239 describes only functions that are derived from AP Module. It does not include any descriptions about domain of the AP nor fundamental concepts that will be useful for the readers of this document.

It is recommended to add such descriptions as follows in the context of within the scope and outside the scope.
1) Main activities of AAM within the scope, e.g. titles of activities of A0 diagram -to manage information to support a product -to generate support solutions -to commission support system -to provide support
2) Information model to support industrial domain specific application is outside the scope.
3) Which of life cycle stages is within the scope, and which is outside the scope.
(2) SC4 part number: 10303-239
(3) Clause: 4.2
(4) Paragraph: NOTE 1 NOTE 2

The ARM EXPRESS index and the module index are displayed in the left side frame when the word "index" is clicked for HTML version.
The description of 4.7.2 in SC4 Standing Document (N1686), "Guidelines for the content of application protocols that use application modules" does not mention how to display the index.
What kind of presentation of index will be provided to readers who print out a modular AP document?
(2) Clause: general

Harmonization should be ensured between ISO/TC 184/SC5 and SC4 standards in general, and the ISO TC184 SC4 standard regarding Product Life Cycle Support (PLCS) in particular. To be able to establish the standard widely in industry this must be resolved.
(2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: Representation of quantity
How should the number of members of a group be modelled? Is the use of Assigned_property adequate or are there other means?
We feel that the number of members is not a property, but a value that is derived from the nature of the group. Something like a derived property would probably be adequate.

comment.description: The number of the members of a group may change over time. This is allowed for in the model. As a consequence, it does not make sense to explicitly represent the quantity. Particularly as the membership of the group may be controlled by effectivity. The number of members can be derived. (Either by software or people).

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A1/A11 etc A113
(3) Paragraph: Task Feedback (Arrow)

2 years ago it was considered that at the A-0/AO level of the model that a generic 'feedback' line was sufficient to indicate an input activity that needed action type work. Activity box A1 maintained this simple generic name instead of 'hundreds of types'. A1 now identifies a Task Feedback (TF) input to box A11 The TF arrow definition "information, in any form, derived from observation of a realized activity including progress, findings or resource use, prior to the capture of this information in the format required by the IM rules" seems inappropriate in areas of the model in which it is used For example on A113 'Evaluate and Co-ord Solution and Variance TF is used to bring 2 (two) feedback returns; business impact of solution and solution definition report into 1131, and 1132,1133. The requests were issued 'under' IM rules therefore TF is inappropriate or the definition is incorrect

comment.description: Rejected. Task feedback is the arrow between A43 and A44. A44 transforms task feedback into support feedback. Support feedback becomes a constituent of the generic feedback arrow. Arrow decomposition is good IDEF0 modelling style.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A0
(3) Paragraph: Operator Feedback (OF)

2 years ago it was considered that at the A-0/AO level of the model that a generic 'feedback' line was sufficient to indicate an input activity that needed action type work. Why is OF required when it dealt with within the AAM as Support Feedback "information provided to support authorities by operators including information on product health and usage, and equipment problems discovered by operators - May include trouble reports, log books and other data from on board recording systems, passed to support authorities for analysis. The operator feedback is structured to conform to the information management rules by activity A4.4 and is communicated within this model by the support feedback arrow."
Revert to 'feedback', "information of relevance to support that is derived from experience or observation - I

comment.description: Rejected. A44 transforms operator feedback into support feedback. Support feedback becomes a constituent of the generic feedback arrow. Arrow decomposition is good IDEF0 modelling style.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A11
Manage Issue definition incorrect "action top record and assess issues according to type and priority" Delete the 'p' to make it read correctly
"Action to record and assess issues according to type and priority"

comment.description: Accepted. This error was already fixed in DIS ballot version.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A111
(3) Paragraph: Variance

The definition of variance has changed from the CM agreed definition in 2.13 NOW - a departure from the design intent as specified by the Assured Product and Support Information WAS - A departure from the design intent as reflected in the Assured Product and Support Information.

Arrow Note: 1. Design Intent includes the design of the support system, the manufacturing system etc. Acceptance of a Variance does not change the PIF baseline. 2. Different organizations have one or more words to describe departures from the design baseline, thus this definition is intended to cover terms such as: waiver, concession, non-conformance, production permit, acceptable fault etc.

comment.description: Accepted. Changed note for arrow.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A1111

Box 'Register Issue' definition requires amending - action to document, identify and monitor issues that may require a change management activity and impact assessment - Insert configuration in front of change
action to document, identify and monitor issues that may require a configuration change management activity and impact assessment

comment.description: Accepted. Changed definition for activity.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A122 A1221 A12212
(3) Paragraph: Required structures

The definition of 'required structures' states 'the set of product assembly or breakdown views that the life cycle owner requires to establish and maintain the PIF' This is a CONSTRAINT on box A1221 'Develop Structure Views which flows down to A12212 'LOAD PRODUCT ASSEMBLY STRUCTURE'- which is defined as 'action to import the design assembly structure for each product variant and version for each product within the PIF scope' The output arrow from this activity is a 'product assembly. Phew!!! The problem as I see it is that this product view is the basic catalyst for the rest of theA1221 activities of creating 'breakdowns' BUT there is no input arrow from A12212 to the rest of the 4 other boxes
Make a12212 the feeder into the rest of the activity boxes on A1221

comment.description: Accepted. Decomposition of A1221 has been remodelled.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A242 A24211 A2422
(3) Paragraph: Request for task. procedure Unresolved support driver

Define Potential Task - Box A2422 activity is defined as 'action to define the method by which a potential task shall be performed, including sequencing of steps within the task, requirements for additional or consequential tasks, warnings and cautions applicable to the task, the identification of task predecessors and successors, the task pre- and post-conditions and the support resources required to achieve the task, including necessary skills and experience' A2422Output arrow 'request for task procedure' (defined as a request for the development of a task procedure for an intended task not addressed by the support solution definition) is an input to A24211 Identify potential tasks whose ONLY sensible OUTPUT is which is defined as a support driver for which no effective response can be found. Is this correct
Clarification sought.

comment.description: Accepted. Added note to activity A24221.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A242 A2422
(3) Paragraph: Requirement to design
Change to the more generic 'Request to LCO'

comment.description: Accepted. Changed definition of arrow to indicate that design covers operating instructions.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A315

Box 315 is named Scheduled commissioning task' with its definition as "action to develop the commissioning plan logic and identify when commissioning tasks must start and finish to make support capability available by the expected first use dates, derived from the operational schedule" The input arrow is 'commissioning program logic' which is an output from A314. It is assumed that plan should read program or is just a loose descriptive
Change plan to program?

comment.description: Accepted. Changed plan to programme.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM A442

Activity box Analyze Support Feedback is defined as "analysis of support feedback from individual tasks to determine exceptions from the support solution, exceptional maintenance needs, the impact on operations, and suggestions for improvement". It is inputted by support feedback, BUT it still seems to retain a 'support feedback' output. This cannot be good modelling
Delete input of support feedback to A442. This is only used as a collector from the 7 outputs of box A441

comment.description: Accepted. Outputs from A441 are no longer combined.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM 12214

Certainly 12214 is a villain and has no place in the PLCS AAM model. We had a long debate over the PLCS exploders in '03 about "Logistically Significant Item", "Maintenance Significant Item" etc. The experts, including myself, maintained that such designations had no place in the definition of product breakdown views. At best, they can be used to qualify a node in a breakdown, but one man's scrap is another man's repairable

comment.description: Accepted. Decomposition of A1221 has been remodelled.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM / A1221, A12212 Scope

The AAM does not appear to cover the life cycle of a product. E.g. under A1221 the node A12212 refers to loading an assembly structure. Where does this come from and why is there no Develop Assembly Structure activity? The model assumes that the assembly (& design) have already been developed (elsewhere). It is not clear that the design activity is outside of the scope of PLCS.

Either, Redesign this AAM, or Create the relevant activity breakdown for the development of the assembly. This may also require earlier dependant activities to be defined e.g. the design, requirements etc.., Or, add design to the out of scope statement.

comment.description: Accepted. Decomposition of A1221 has been remodelled.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM 1221

Remove "load assembly structure" as this is provided as an input to each activity.
Remove LSI view

comment.description: Accepted. Decomposition of A1221 has been remodelled.

description.p: (2) Clause: AIM Mappings
(3) Paragraph: 5.1
Only 2 (ISO 10303-1287 (AP239 activity recording) & ISO 10303-1304 (AP239 product status recording)) of the 5 implementation models for AP239 are provided in section 5.1. Where are the rest?
Include mappings for; ISO 10303-1292 AP239 product definition information ISO 10303-1307 AP239 work definition ISO 10303-1306 AP239 task specification resourced
Clause 5.1 Mapping specification is the mapping specification of the AP module ap239_product_life_cycle_support. The module simply uses from:
description.screen: USE FROM Ap239_activity_recording_mim; -- ISO/TS 10303-1287 USE FROM Ap239_product_status_recording_mim; -- ISO/TS 10303-1304
description.p: There is nothing in the module to map, hence the XSL refers to the two modules.
Arguably we could allow modules to be explicitly listed, but why should this type of module be treated any differently?
(2) Clause: Annex A
The links provided for the EXPRESS expanded listings for the ARM and for the MIM both point to the ARM longform file.
Add MIM longform in the link.

comment.description: Change made and issues copied to stepmod/doc/issues/apdoc_issues.xml

description.p: (2) Clause: 6.0
A single Conformance Class does not add to the usability of PLCS.
Add CC classes based upon the Dex development program in Oasis. Or, at the implementation module level.

comment.description: It was agreed at the San Diego SC4 meeting that conformance classes could only really be sensibly defined once the AP had been in business use for a while. Consequently, new APs can define a single conformance class. Once the PLCS DEXs have been completed and are in use, an issue will be raised against the AP239 to add the appropriate DEXs as AP239 conformance classes. At this stage, the DEXs are too immature to be proposed as conformance classes.

description.p: (2) Clause: PICS
The PICS in Annex D only refers to P21 implementations. Does this mean that only systems generating P21 files will be able to claim PLCS conformance?
Suggest adding P28, SDAI & others.

Which Part 28 binding? I think that it is preferable to only have one Part 28 bindings in an AP. (This is a business requirement expressed by several PLCS members) The proposal is that is the Part 28 edition 2 binding so that an XML Schema representation can be provided. However, Part 28 edition 2 has not been published yet, so the recommendation is that no XML binding is advocated.

The SDAI binding is extremely low level. Is there any value inn advocating it? A better approach is to develop a high level web service binding. This can be standardized as part of the pLCS OASIS work. Furthermore, standards such as AP214, AP210 only specify Part 21, and do not explicitly specify SDAI.
(2) Clause: Conformance
How will conformance to PLCS be determined?
Provide some material for dissemination in the PICS section?

comment.description: This will require a change to XSL boilerplate. There is an example in AP214 which could be modified.

description.p: (2) Clause: Validation Report
Is there a validation report for PLCS? This was not distributed with the AP.
Distribure validation report.

comment.description: A validation report was issued with the AP.

description.p: (2) Clause: Annex A & other places
Is there an Inconsistent use of ISO 10303-439 and ISO/DIS 10303-239 on this page? Not clear what the difference is for many people.
Clarify usage

comment.description: There is no inconsistency in Annex A of the AP document. The Annex is referring to the AP modules (439). This is correct. Please advise if there are other inconsistencies.

description.p: (2) Clause: Bibliography
There appears to be no mention of the PDM schema on which the PLCS model was based & is discussed in the text in various places.
Add reference to PDM schema.

comment.description: There is no reference to the PDM schema in the AP document, hence, no mention in the bibliography of the document.

description.p: (2) Clause: Index
The index appears to list mainly terms defined in the AAM and the implementation modules. Nothing else - which would seem too short for a document like this.
Add full index.

comment.description: The index that you refer to is the index for the AP document. There is a complete index referencing all the modules, arm, mim objects and mappings in a separate frame. Perhaps we should add a set of hyperlink in the AP document index that links to these indexes to make their existence more obvious.

description.p: (2) Clause: Annex C

Given that PLCS/Oasis have decided to use the technique of "classification" to replace the use of many id & role attributes of the PLCS model, should this information be placed within the annex on Implementation method specific requirements. This would be logical since there already exists advice on the representation of empty strings and the like.
Add text accordingly.
(2) Clause: Annex C

Given that PLCS/Oasis have decided to implement at the ARM level rather than the MIM, should this not also be added in the Implementation annex? At least to say that an ARM implementation should be considered for conformance?
Add text accordingly.
(2) Clause: Express - View_definition_context
PLCS requires reference data for View_definition_context.life_cycle_stage and application_domain.
The CADMID cycle appears to be one source. Application domains include "product life cycle support" and "logistic support analysis".

comment.description: This would be implemented by reference data which is not part of the standard. "product life cycle support" and "logistic support analysis" will be added to Application domains reference data. The lifecyle phases should be Concept, Assessment, Development, Manufacture, In-service, Disposal.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM
(3) Paragraph: F1.31
change "authorised task" to "authorized task".

comment.description: Accepted. Changed spelling.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM
(3) Paragraph: F1.145
change "first use date" to "first-use date".

comment.description: Accepted. Hyphen added.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM
(3) Paragraph: F1.276
change "authorise" to "authorize".

comment.description: Accepted. Spelling changed.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM
(3) Paragraph: F1.293
change "request solution development & impact assessment" to "request for solution development & impact assessment".

comment.description: Accepted. Additional word *for* inserted in arrow name.

description.p: (2) Clause: AAM
(3) Paragraph: Figure F.18
- A2 generate_support_solutions: change activity to "Generate support solution". Add a note to indicate multiple activation is possible.

comment.description: Accepted. Name changed and note added.

description.p: (2) Clause: AP index

Under the "AP index" link, the two indices "Module ARMs" and "Module MIMs" work differently. The latter sorts with "_" before blank and the former vice versa (i.e. "activity" before "activity_as_realized".

comment.description: Addressed

description.p: (2) Clause: Clause 5.1
Boiler plate for Clause 5.1 mentions UoF, which is an out-of-date concept.

comment.description: The boilerplate (xsl) should be changed for all the modules.

description.p: Changed the text to "This clause contains the mapping specification that defines how each application element of this part of ISO 10303 (see Clause 4) maps to one or more MIM elements (see Clause 5.2)."
Change made and issues copied to stepmod/doc/issues/modules_issues.xml
(2) Clause: Clause 5.1

Clause 5.1: The phrase "when the considered ARM attribute refers to a type that is not an entity data type or a SELECT type that contains or may contain entity data types" does not appear to be a correct definition for the meaning of a name of a MIM entity attribute.

comment.description: The comment refers to the definition of the TITLE in clause 5.1. That is the title of that which is being mapped in the mapping clause. This may well be an attribute.

description.p: (2) Clause: Clause 5.1

Clause 5.1: The phrase "when the considered ARM entity attribute refers to an entity data type or to a SELECT type that contains or may contain entity data types" does not appear to be a correct definition for the meaning of "PATH".

comment.description: The comment refers to the definition of the TITLE in clause 5.1. That is the title of that which is being mapped in the mapping clause. This may well be an attribute.

description.p: (2) Clause: Bibliography
Bibliography is missing reference to IDFE0: "IEEE 1320.1 Functional modeling language -- Syntax and semantics for IDEF0 (IEEE standard)".

comment.description: Added bibliographic entry

issue.description: The final paragraph of the Introduction to the AP refers to <clause_ref linkend="fundamentals"/>. This is not being displayed.

comment.description: Change made and issues copied to stepmod/doc/issues/apdoc_issues.xml

issue.description: In Annex A of the AP document, it states that "The ARM EXPRESS expanded listing for this part of ISO 10303 is provided in Annex E of the AP module," The link to Annex E is to the EXPRESS, not the Annex. The XSL should be fixed.

comment.description: Corrected the links. Change made and issues copied to stepmod/doc/issues/apdoc_issues.xml

description.p: (2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: ..._assignment.role

It seems that ..._assignment.role attributes shall not be populated. Instead their values shall be given as External_class.name of a Classification_assignment. This needs to b well documented in the standard, probably in the fundamentals section.
(if not done already ...) Update the documentation.

comment.description: Agree - this should be added to the implementation guide for the AP.

issue.description:
All the modules and APs have a bibliographic entry:
Bibliography [1] Draft standing document - for the content of application modules, ISO TC184/SC4/N1161, 2001-05-02.
I presume that this should be:
Bibliography [1] SC4 standing document - for the content of application modules, ISO TC184/SC4 N1685, 2004-02-25.

comment.description: Updated the entry in bibliography.xml AMConGde06
